condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government has strengthened systems to provide equitable, inclusive, quality, learner protection and secondary education

description.narrative: Education system was strengthened to provide an enabling environment to prevent and respond to Violence Against Children (VAC) through the development of School regulations, Discipline Guidelines and VaC Strategy for Education Sector to be implemented in all schools in Eswatini. To improve investigation of VAC cases, all departments (228 key ministry of education officials) were trained on safe schools' environment. Reporting on cases through tollfree line increased from 9 cases in 2018 to 56 cases in 2019 (increase of 83.9%). All schools' inspectors (77) were trained on the implementation of the Strategy Addressing Repetition and Dropouts in Secondary Level. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Percentage of secondary school related violence against children cases investigated and concluded by the Teachers
